claims.claim: The global enterprise agentic AI market was valued at USD 2.58 billion in 2024 and is projected to reach USD 24.50 billion by 2030
The agentic AI market is growing at a CAGR of 46.2% from 2025 to 2030
The broader AI agents market was USD 5.9 billion in 2024, projected to reach USD 105.6 billion by 2034 (CAGR 38.5%)
Approximately 85% of enterprises are expected to implement AI agents by the end of 2025
66.4% of AI agent implementations use multi-agent system designs
79% of organizations have implemented AI agents at some level according to PwC survey
AI agent startups raised $3.8 billion in 2024, nearly tripling investments from the previous year
Companies report average ROI of 171% from AI agents, with U.S. enterprises achieving around 192%
claims.notes: Industry survey - may have selection bias

claims.claim: The term 'Swarm Intelligence' was first introduced by Gerardo Beni and Jing Wang in 1989
Ant Colony Optimization was initially proposed by Marco Dorigo in 1992 in his PhD thesis
Particle Swarm Optimization was developed by James Kennedy and Russell Eberhart in 1995
AutoGen v0.4 adopts an actor model with event-driven, asynchronous architecture for distributed agent systems
AutoGen uses a three-layer architecture: Core API, AgentChat API, and Extensions API
CrewAI uses role-based agent design with three attributes: role, goal, and backstory
OpenAI Swarm is built on two primitives: agents and handoffs, with stateless architecture
OpenAI Swarm has been succeeded by the OpenAI Agents SDK for production use cases
CrewAI has reached 30.5K GitHub stars and 1M monthly downloads
claims.notes: GitHub statistics - may change over time

claims.claim: Multi-agent systems have three key failure modes: miscoordination, conflict, and collusion
GPT-4 can transmit covert steganographic messages 26% of the time without detection in multi-agent scenarios
Emergent behavior in MAS can cause severe performance deviations and catastrophic failures if not properly handled
80% of enterprise IT leaders report facing significant challenges in AI agent adoption
Top barriers to AI agent adoption: cybersecurity (35%), data privacy (30%), regulatory clarity (21%)
45% of organizations are most interested in multiagent systems as a GenAI development according to Deloitte
claims.notes: Deloitte State of Generative AI in Enterprise Report 2025

claims.claim: LangGraph treats workflows as graphs where each node represents a specific task or function
ACO-based solutions account for roughly 45% of swarm intelligence market share
